document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

subSubSection.paragraph: ♂. Head ( Figs 75, 76 ) 1.7–1.9 times as wide as long; vertex in dorsal view evenly rounded; occiput impunctate and polished; vertex and gena weakly and finely punctate and mat; interocellar area polished, faintly and sparsely punctate; geno-orbital index 2.5–3.2 ; frons impunctate, polished and finely coriaceous, with a weak median longitudinal groove; face 1.4 times as wide as long, rather more strongly punctate than vertex; supraclypeal suture distinct; clypeus 1.9–2.2 times as wide as long, rather more sparsely punctate than face, with apical margin truncate and weakly concave medially; antenna with 45–50 flagellomeres, 1 st flagellomere 1.5–1.6 times as long as 2 nd, 2 nd 2.7–2.9 times as long as wide.
Fore tibial spur 0.5 times as long as 1 st tarsomere, which is 9.5–11.1 times as long as wide; fore tarsal claw with 15–26 pectines; hind tarsal claw with 10–16 pectines.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head and mesosoma yellow; occiput slightly brownish-yellow; antenna reddish-yellow; mesoscutum with brownish yellow to yellowish-brown stripes on each of median and lateral lobes; scutellum and propodeum brownish-yellow. Legs brownish-yellow; fore coxa yellow; hind tarsus whitish-yellow. Wings hyaline; vein C and pterostigma of fore wing brownish-yellow, other veins brown. Metasoma brownish-yellow to reddish-yellow.

Holotype : ♂, Mt. Shiragadake, Ue, Kumamoto Pref.,
5 . ix. 1992
(R. Noda, at light), NIAES .

Etymology. This species is named in honor of Mr. Ryo Noda, who collected the holotype of this species and many other specimens of
Netelia
.

Remarks. This species belongs to the
virgata
group as stated in the remarks for
comitor
.
